---
applyTo: "**/*.ts"
---

- Split different methods and modules into separat files.
- Apply the division of concerns principle to organize code logically.
- Ensure each module has a single folder for related files.
- Use descriptive names for files and folders to enhance readability.
- Include comments and documentation for complex logic to aid future maintenance.
- Ensure that comments describe the "why" behind the code, not just the "what".
- Ensure that comments are up-to-date with the code they describe and don't describe code changes.
- Follow consistent coding standards and formatting throughout the project.
- Use TypeScript features such as interfaces and types to enhance code clarity and maintainability.
- Write unit tests for each module to ensure functionality and facilitate future changes.
- Ensure that unit tests cover edge cases and potential failure points.
